pages.text: The central component of MIMI is creating and playing instruments. MIMI provides a large variety of different instruments that you can craft and play by yourself or with others.$(br2)Let's make your first instrument!

pages.title: Crafting and Playing
pages.text: $(br)Once you've crafted the instrument shown above simply hold it in your main hand and right click to open the instrument GUI.

pages.title: The Instrument GUI
pages.text: You should now see the instrument GUI on your screen.$(br2)This GUI lets you play the instrument you're holding either by pressing the keys on your keyboard shown on the piano or by simply clicking the note you want to play.$(br2)The right side of the GUI shows the controls for shifting the displayed piano up and down so that you can play lower or higher notes.

pages.title: The Instrument GUI
pages.text: The $(l)ZNote$() indicator displays which note on the piano is currently mapped to Z on your keyboard.$(br2)The top section of the instrument GUI lets you configure the MIDI settings of your instrument which can be used to play notes from a configured system MIDI device or a linked Maestro.
